page.title: 07Employment.
page.content: The general trend in unemployment in the Soulbury/Linslade area is well below the national average. As the area is a commuter belt, many people in Linslade and the surrounding villages go to London, Milton Keynes and the other larger towns with good motorway and rail links. Many women, however, especially married women, seek part-time employment locally in light industry, shops and offices in the area. There is very little"Apprentice" style training of the old kind available locally and the need appears to be for highly skilled people. Industrial dispute is virtually non-existent as most people work in small units, offices or family run shops, where any disputes can be settled at grass-root level, without the need for unions or Arbitration.
